title: PRIEST: predicting viral mutations with immune escape capability of SARS-CoV-2 using temporal evolutionary information
abstract: Abstract The dynamic evolution of the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 virus is primarily driven by mutations in its genetic sequence, culminating in the emergence of variants with increased capability to evade host immune responses. Accurate prediction of such mutations is fundamental in mitigating pandemic spread and developing effective control measures. This study introduces a robust and interpretable deep-learning approach called PRIEST. This innovative model leverages time-series viral sequences to foresee potential viral mutations. Our comprehensive experimental evaluations underscore PRIEST’s proficiency in accurately predicting immune-evading mutations. Our work represents a substantial step in utilizing deep-learning methodologies for anticipatory viral mutation analysis and pandemic response.

tldr.text: This study introduces a robust and interpretable deep-learning approach called PRIEST, which leverages time-series viral sequences to foresee potential viral mutations and represents a substantial step in utilizing deep-learning methodologies for anticipatory viral mutation analysis and pandemic response.
